Class ec.ifc.app.ECButton 
All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index

Class ec.ifc.app.ECButton 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----netscape.application.View
           |
           +----netscape.application.Button
                   |
                   +----ec.ifc.app.ECButton
public class ECButton
extends Button
implements DragDestination
This class overwrites continuous push button functionality of IFC's Button class Reason - bugs in IFC It doesn't rely on Button's timer, instead, it has it's own timer and delay It maintains its own CONTINUOUS_TYPE type, preserving Button's public API 06.20.97 dima Added support for drag and drop, so from now on it's not pure netscape.application.Button

ECButton()

acceptsDrag(DragSession, int, int)
Returns "this" as a DragDestination object.
addObserver(Observer)
Adds Observer to the list of those who will be notified of drag'n'drop event
dragCommand()
Returns the string command that is sent to Observable object
dragDropped(DragSession)
DragDestination method
dragEntered(DragSession)
DragDestination method
dragExited(DragSession)
DragDestination method If the instance of this class supports hilite/unhilite during drag'n'drop, it will cause the tab to be unhilited
dragMoved(DragSession)
DragDestination method
mouseDown(MouseEvent)
Overwrites Button.mouseDown Reasons - a) Button's mouseDown is still being called when mouse is disabled b) as we are overwriting continuous push button functionality, we need to start our timer
mouseUp(MouseEvent)
Overwrites Button.mouseUp Reasons - a) Button's mouseUp doesn't stop the timer b) as we are overwriting continuous push button functionality, we need to stop our timer
notifier()
Returns Observable notifier IV
repeatDelay()
Overwrites Button.repeatDelay Reason - we maintain our own timer and don't rely on Button's repeatDelay
setCommand(String)
Overwrites Button.setCommand Reason - sequence of calls setTarget, setCommand, setType is random, we need to make sure the timer will be properly created for CONTINUOUS_TYPE buttons
setDragCommand(String)
Sets the string command that will be sent to Observable object
setEnabled(boolean)
Overwrites Button.setEnabled Reason - make sure we stop the timer when it is disabled
setRepeatDelay(int)
Overwrites Button.setRepeatDelay Reason - we maintain our own timer and don't rely on Buttons repeat delay
setTarget(Target)
Overwrites Button.setTarget Reason - sequence of calls setTarget, setCommand, setType is random, we need to make sure the timer will be properly created for CONTINUOUS_TYPE buttons
setType(int)
Overwrites Button.setType Reason - sequence of calls setTarget, setCommand, setType is random, we need to make sure the timer will be properly created for CONTINUOUS_TYPE buttons
type()
Overwrites Button.setType Reason - we maintain our special case of CONTINUOUS_TYPE handling
